010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
033 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
034 * object structures. 
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays {@code A[r][c]}, where {@code r} is the 
036 * (vertical) <strong>row</strong> index
037 * and {@code c} is the (horizontal) <strong>column</strong> index (as common in linear algebra). 
038 * This means that matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
039 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
040 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * Note: Methods named with a trailing '{@code D}' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
044 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the supplied arguments.
045 * </p>
046 * 
047 * @author WB
048 * @version 2022/08/29
049 */
050@SuppressWarnings("serial")
051public abstract class Matrix {
052        
053        private Matrix() {}
054        
055        // TODO: check if these variables should be public and non-final
056        
057        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
058        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
059        
060        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
061        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
062        
063        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
064        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
065        
066        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
067        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
068        
069        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
070        
071        /**
072         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
073         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
074         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
075         * </p>
076         * <pre>
077         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
078         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
079         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
080         * <p>
081         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
082         * </p>
083         * 
084         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
085         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
086         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
087         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
088         */
089        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
090                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
091                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
092                        return A;
093                }
094                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
095                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
096                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
097                }
098                
099                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
100                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
101                                A[r][c] = values[i];
102                                i++;
103                        }
104                }               
105                return A;
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * <p>
110         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
111         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
112         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
113         * </p>
114         * <pre>
115         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
116         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
117         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
118         * <p>
119         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
120         * </p>
121         * 
122         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
123         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
124         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
125         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
126         */
127        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
128                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
129                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
130                        return A;
131                }
132                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
133                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
134                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
135                }       
136                
137                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
138                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
139                                A[r][c] = values[i];
140                                i++;
141                        }
142                }               
143                return A;
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * <p>
148         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
149         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
150         * </p>
151         * <pre>
152         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
153         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
154         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
155         * <p>
156         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
157         * </p>
158         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
159         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
160         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
161         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
162         */
163        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
164                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
165        }
166        
167
168        /**
169         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
170         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
171         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
172         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
173         *  
174         * @param A a matrix
175         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
176         */
177        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
178                final int rows = A.length;
179                final int cols = A[0].length;
180                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
181                int i = 0;
182                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
183                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
184                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
185                                i++;
186                        }
187                }
188                return vals;
189        }
190        
191        /**
192         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
193         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
194         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
195         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
196         *  
197         * @param A a matrix
198         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
199         */
200        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
201                final int rows = A.length;
202                final int cols = A[0].length;
203                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
204                int i = 0;
205                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
206                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
207                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
208                                i++;
209                        }
210                }
211                return vals;
212        }
213        
214        /**
215         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
216         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
217         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
218         *  
219         * @param A a matrix
220         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
221         */
222        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
223                return flatten(A.getData());
224        }
225        
226        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
227        
228        /**
229         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
230         * specified values.
231         * 
232         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
233         * @return a {@code double[]}
234         */
235        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
236                return values;
237        }
238        
239        /**
240         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
241         * specified values.
242         * 
243         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
244         * @return a {@code float[]}
245         */
246        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
247                return values;
248        }
249        
250        /**
251         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
252         * specified {@code double} values.
253         * 
254         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
255         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
256         */
257        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
258                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
259//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
260        }
261        
262        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
263        
264        /**
265         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
266         * specified length.
267         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
268         * @param length the length of the vector
269         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
270         */
271        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
272                if (length < 1)
273                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
274                return new double[length];
275        }
276        
277        /**
278         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
279         * specified size.
280         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
281         * @param size the size of the matrix
282         * @return an identity matrix
283         */
284        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
285                if (size < 1)
286                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
287                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
288                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
289                        A[i][i] = 1;
290                }
291                return A;
292        }
293        
294        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
295
296        /**
297         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
298         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
299         * @return the number of rows
300         */
301        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
302                return A.length;
303        }
304        
305        
306        /**
307         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
308         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
309         * @return the number of columns
310         */
311        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
312                return A[0].length;
313        }
314        
315        /**
316         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
317         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
318         * @return the number of rows
319         */
320        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
321                return A.length;
322        }
323        
324        /**
325         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
326         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
327         * @return the number of columns
328         */
329        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
330                return A[0].length;
331        }
332        
333        /**
334         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
335         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
336         * @return the number of rows
337         */
338        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
339                return A.getRowDimension();
340        }
341        
342        /**
343         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
344         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
345         * @return the number of columns
346         */
347        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
348                return A.getColumnDimension();
349        }
350        
351        // Extract rows or columns
352        
353        /**
354         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
355         * as a {@code double} vector.
356         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
357         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
358         * @return a {@code double} vector
359         */
360        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
361                return A[r].clone();
362        }
363        
364        /**
365         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
366         * as a {@code float} vector.
367         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
368         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
369         * @return a {@code float} vector
370         */
371        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
372                return A[r].clone();
373        }
374        
375        /**
376         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
377         * as a {@code double} vector.
378         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
379         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
380         * @return a {@code double} vector
381         */
382        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
383                final int rows = A.length;
384                double[] col = new double[rows];
385                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
386                        col[r] = A[r][c];
387                }
388                return col;
389        }
390        
391        /**
392         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
393         * as a {@code float} vector.
394         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
395         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
396         * @return a {@code float} vector
397         */
398        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
399                final int rows = A.length;
400                float[] col = new float[rows];
401                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
402                        col[r] = A[r][c];
403                }
404                return col;
405        }
406        
407        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
408        
409        /**
410         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
411         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
412         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
413         */
414        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
415                final int nCols = A[0].length;
416                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
417                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
418                                return false;
419                        }
420                }
421                return true;
422        }
423        
424        /**
425         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
426         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
427         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
428         */
429        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
430                final int nCols = A[0].length;
431                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
432                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
433                                return false;
434                        }
435                }
436                return true;
437        }
438        
439        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
440         * and columns.
441         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
442         * @return true iff the matrix is square
443         */
444        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
445                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
446        }
447        
448        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
449         * and columns.
450         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
451         * @return true iff the matrix is square
452         */
453        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
454                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
455        }
456        
457        /**
458         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
459         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
460         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
461         */
462        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
463                if (!isSquare(A)) {
464                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
465                }
466                final int n = A.length;
467                double[] diag = new double[n];
468                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
469                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
470                }
471                return diag;
472        }
473        
474        /**
475         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
476         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
477         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
478         */
479        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
480                if (!isSquare(A)) {
481                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
482                }
483                final int n = A.length;
484                float[] diag = new float[n];
485                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
486                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
487                }
488                return diag;
489        }
490        
491        /**
492         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
493         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
494         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
495         */
496        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
497                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
498        }
499        
500        /**
501         * Creates and returns a diagonal matrix from the specified 
502         * vector. See also {@link #getDiagonal(double[][])}.
503         * 
504         * @param d vector of diagonal matrix elements
505         * @return a diagonal matrix
506         */
507        public double[][] diagMatrix(double[] d) {
508                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d).getData();
509        }
510        
511        /**
512         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
513         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
514         * @return true if the matrix is singular
515         */
516        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
517                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
518                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
519                }       
520                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
521        }
522        
523        /**
524         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
525         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
526         * @return true if the matrix is singular
527         */
528        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
529                if (!A.isSquare()) {
530                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
531                }               
532                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
533                return !solver.isNonSingular();
534        }
535        
536        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
537        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
538        
539        /**
540         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
541         * using the specified relative tolerance.
542         * @param A a square matrix
543         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
544         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
545         */
546        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
547                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
548        }
549        
550        /**
551         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
552         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
553         * @param A a square matrix
554         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
555         */
556        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
557                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
558        }
559        
560        /**
561         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
562         * using the specified relative tolerance.
563         * @param A a square matrix
564         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
565         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
566         */
567        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
568                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
569        }
570        
571        /**
572         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
573         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
574         * @param A a square matrix
575         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
576         */
577        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
578                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
579        }
580        
581        /**
582         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
583         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
584         * 
585         * @param A a square matrix
586         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
587         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
588         */
589        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
590                try {
591                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
592                        return true;
593                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
594                return false;
595        }
596        
597        /**
598         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
599         * @param A a square matrix
600         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
601         */
602        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
603                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
604        }
605        
606        /**
607         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
608         * @param a first vector
609         * @param b second vector
610         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
611         */
612        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
613                return a.length == b.length;
614        }
615        
616        /**
617         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
618         * @param a first vector
619         * @param b second vector
620         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
621         */
622        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
623                return a.length == b.length;
624        }
625        
626        /**
627         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
628         * @param A first matrix
629         * @param B second matrix
630         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
631         */
632        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
633                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
634        }
635        
636        /**
637         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
638         * @param A first matrix
639         * @param B second matrix
640         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
641         */
642        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
643                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
644        }
645
646        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
647
648        /**
649         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[]} vector. 
650         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
651         * @return a copy of the vector
652         */
653        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] a) {
654                return a.clone();
655        }
656        
657        /**
658         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[]} vector. 
659         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
660         * @return a copy of the vector
661         */
662        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] a) {
663                return a.clone();
664        }
665
666        /**
667         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[][]} matrix. 
668         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
669         * @return a copy of the matrix
670         */
671        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
672                final int m = A.length;
673                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
674                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
675                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
676                }
677                return B;
678        }
679        
680        /**
681         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[][]} matrix. 
682         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
683         * @return a copy of the matrix
684         */
685        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
686                final int m = A.length;
687                float[][] B = new float[m][];
688                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
689                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
690                }
691                return B;
692        }
693        
694        // vector copying ------------------------------
695        
696        /**
697         * Copy data from one {@code float[]} vector to another.
698         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
699         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
700         * @param target the target vector (modified)
701         */
702        public static void copyD(float[] source, float[] target) {
703                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
704        }
705        
706        /**
707         * Copy data from one {@code double[]} vector to another.
708         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
709         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
710         * @param target the target vector (modified)
711         */
712        public static void copyD(double[] source, double[] target) {
713                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
714        }
715        
716        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
717        
718        /**
719         * Converts a {@code double[]} to a {@code float[]}.
720         * @param a the original {@code double[]} array
721         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[]}
722         */
723        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] a) {
724                final int m = a.length;
725                final float[] b = new float[m];
726                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
727                        b[i] = (float) a[i];
728                }
729                return b;
730        }
731        
732        /**
733         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code float[][]}.
734         * @param A the original {@code double[][]} array
735         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
736         */
737        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
738                final int m = A.length;
739                final int n = A[0].length;
740                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
741                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
742                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
743                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
744                        }
745                }
746                return B;
747        }
748        
749        /**
750         * Converts a {@code float[]} to a {@code double[]}.
751         * @param a the original {@code float[]} array
752         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[]}
753         */
754        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] a) {
755                final int m = a.length;
756                final double[] B = new double[m];
757                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
758                        B[i] = a[i];
759                }
760                return B;
761        }
762        
763        /**
764         * Converts a {@code float[][]} to a {@code double[][]}.
765         * @param A the original {@code float[][]} array
766         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[][]}
767         */
768        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
769                final int m = A.length;
770                final int n = A[0].length;
771                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
772                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
773                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
774                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
775                        }
776                }
777                return B;
778        }
779        
780        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
781        
782        /**
783         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
784         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
785         * @param val the fill value
786         */
787        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
788                Arrays.fill(x, val);
789        }
790        
791        /**
792         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
793         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
794         * @param val the fill value
795         */
796        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
797                Arrays.fill(x, val);
798        }
799        
800        /**
801         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
802         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
803         * @param val the fill value
804         */
805        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
806                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
807                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
808                }
809        }
810        
811        /**
812         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
813         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
814         * @param val the fill value
815         */
816        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
817                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
818                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
819                }
820        }
821        
822
823        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
824        
825        /**
826         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
827         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
828         * different lengths.
829         * None of the arguments is modified.
830         * @param a the first vector
831         * @param b the second vector
832         * @return a new {@code double} vector
833         */
834        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
835                double[] c = b.clone();
836                addD(a, c);
837                return c;
838        }
839        
840        /**
841         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
842         * to the second vector (destructively).
843         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
844         * different lengths.
845         * The second vector is modified.
846         * @param a the first vector
847         * @param b the second vector
848         */
849        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
850                if (!sameSize(a, b))
851                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
852                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
853                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
854                }
855        }
856        
857        /**
858         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
859         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
860         * different lengths.
861         * None of the arguments is modified.
862         * @param a the first vector
863         * @param b the second vector
864         * @return a new {@code float} vector
865         */
866        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
867                float[] c = b.clone();
868                addD(a, c);
869                return c;
870        }
871        
872        /**
873         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
874         * to the second vector (destructively).
875         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
876         * The second vector is modified.
877         * @param a the first vector
878         * @param b the second vector
879         */
880        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
881                if (!sameSize(a, b))
882                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
883                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
884                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
885                }
886        }
887
888        /**
889         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
890         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
891         * different size.
892         * None of the arguments is modified.
893         * @param A the first matrix
894         * @param B the second matrix
895         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
896         */
897        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
898                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
899                addD(A, C);
900                return C;
901        }
902        
903        /**
904         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
905         * to the second vector (destructively).
906         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
907         * different size.
908         * The second matrix is modified.
909         * @param A the first matrix
910         * @param B the second matrix
911         */
912        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
913                if (!sameSize(A, B))
914                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
915                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
916                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
917                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
918                        }
919                }
920        }
921        
922        /**
923         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
924         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
925         * different size.
926         * None of the arguments is modified.
927         * @param A the first matrix
928         * @param B the second matrix
929         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
930         */
931        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
932                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
933                addD(A, C);
934                return C;
935        }
936        
937        /**
938         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
939         * to the second vector (destructively).
940         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
941         * different size.
942         * The second matrix is modified.
943         * @param A the first matrix
944         * @param B the second matrix
945         */
946        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
947                if (!sameSize(A, B))
948                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
949                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
950                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
951                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
952                        }
953                }
954        }
955        
956        // ------------------------------------------------
957        
958        /**
959         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
960         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
961         * different lengths.
962         * None of the arguments is modified.
963         * @param a the first vector
964         * @param b the second vector
965         * @return a new {@code double} vector
966         */
967        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
968                if (!sameSize(a, b))
969                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
970                final int n = a.length;
971                double[] c = new double[n];
972                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
973                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
974                }
975                return c;
976        }
977        
978        // non-destructive a - b
979        /**
980         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
981         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
982         * different lengths.
983         * None of the arguments is modified.
984         * @param a the first vector
985         * @param b the second vector
986         * @return a new {@code float} vector
987         */
988        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
989                if (!sameSize(a, b))
990                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
991                final int n = a.length;
992                float[] c = new float[n];
993                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
994                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
995                }
996                return c;
997        }
998
999        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
1000
1001        // non-destructive
1002        /**
1003         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1004         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
1005         * @param s a scalar
1006         * @param x a vector
1007         * @return a new vector
1008         */
1009        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
1010                double[] b = x.clone();
1011                multiplyD(s, b);
1012                return b;
1013        }
1014        
1015        // destructive
1016        /**
1017         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
1018         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1019         * @param s a scalar
1020         * @param x a vector
1021         */
1022        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
1023                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1024                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1025                }
1026        }
1027        
1028        // non-destructive
1029        /**
1030         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1031         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1032         * @param s a scalar
1033         * @param A a matrix
1034         * @return a new matrix
1035         */
1036        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1037                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
1038                multiplyD(s, B);
1039                return B;
1040        }
1041        
1042        /**
1043         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1044         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1045         * @param s a scalar
1046         * @param A a matrix
1047         */
1048        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1049                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1050                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1051                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1052                        }
1053                }
1054        }
1055        
1056        // non-destructive
1057        /**
1058         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1059         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
1060         * @param s a scalar
1061         * @param x a vector
1062         * @return a new vector
1063         */
1064        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
1065                float[] B = duplicate(x);
1066                multiplyD(s, B);
1067                return B;
1068        }
1069        
1070        // destructive
1071        /**
1072         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
1073         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1074         * @param s a scalar
1075         * @param x a matrix
1076         */
1077        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1078                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1079                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1080                }
1081        }
1082
1083        // non-destructive
1084        /**
1085         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1086         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1087         * @param s a scalar
1088         * @param A a matrix
1089         * @return a new matrix
1090         */
1091        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1092                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1093                multiplyD(s, B);
1094                return B;
1095        }
1096        
1097        // destructive
1098        /**
1099         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1100         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1101         * @param s a scalar
1102         * @param A a matrix
1103         */
1104        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1105                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1106                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1107                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1108                        }
1109                }
1110        }
1111        
1112        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1113
1114        /**
1115         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1116         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1117         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1118         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1119         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1120         */
1121        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1122                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1123                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1124                return y;
1125        }
1126        
1127        /**
1128         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1129         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1130         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1131         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1132         */
1133        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1134                if (x == y) 
1135                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1136                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1137                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1138                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1139                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1140                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1141                        double s = 0;
1142                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1143                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1144                        }
1145                        y[i] = s;
1146                }
1147        }
1148
1149        /**
1150         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1151         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1152         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1153         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1154         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1155         */
1156        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1157                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1158                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1159                return y;
1160        }
1161        
1162        /**
1163         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1164         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1165         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1166         * which is modified.
1167         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1168         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1169         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1170         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1171         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1172         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1173         */
1174        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1175                if (x == y) 
1176                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1177                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1178                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1179                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1180                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1181                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1182                        double s = 0;
1183                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1184                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1185                        }
1186                        y[i] = s;
1187                }
1188        }
1189        
1190        /**
1191         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1192         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1193         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1194         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1195         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1196         */
1197        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1198                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1199                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1200                return y;
1201        }
1202        
1203        /**
1204         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1205         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1206         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1207         * which is modified.
1208         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1209         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1210         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1211         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1212         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1213         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1214         */
1215        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1216                if (x == y) 
1217                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1218                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1219                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1220                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1221                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1222                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1223                        double s = 0;
1224                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1225                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1226                        }
1227                        y[i] = (float) s;
1228                }
1229        }
1230        
1231
1232        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1233        
1234        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1235        /**
1236         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1237         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1238         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1239         * @param A first matrix
1240         * @param B second matrix
1241         * @return the matrix product A * B
1242         */
1243        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1244                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1245                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1246                if (nA != mB)
1247                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1248                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1249                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1250                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1251                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1252                return C;
1253        }
1254        
1255        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1256        /**
1257         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1258         * and places the results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C,
1259         * which is modified (destructively).
1260         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1261         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1262         * @param A first matrix
1263         * @param B second matrix
1264         * @param C the result matrix
1265         */
1266        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1267                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1268                if (A == C || B == C) 
1269                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1270                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1271                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1272                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1273                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1274                if (nA != mB)
1275                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1276                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1277                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1278                
1279                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1280                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1281                                double s = 0;
1282                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1283                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1284                                }
1285                                C[i][j] = s;
1286                        }
1287                }
1288        }
1289        
1290        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1291        /**
1292         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1293         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1294         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1295         * @param A first matrix
1296         * @param B second matrix
1297         * @return the matrix product A * B
1298         */
1299        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1300                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1301                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1302                if (nA != mB)
1303                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1304                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1305                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1306                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1307                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1308                return C;
1309        }
1310
1311        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1312        /**
1313         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1314         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1315         * which is modified (destructively).
1316         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1317         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1318         * @param A first matrix
1319         * @param B second matrix
1320         * @param C the result matrix
1321         */
1322        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1323                if (A == C || B == C) 
1324                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1325                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1326                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1327                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1328                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1329                if (nA != mB)
1330                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1331                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1332                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1333                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1334                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1335                                float s = 0;
1336                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1337                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1338                                }
1339                                C[i][j] = s;
1340                        }
1341                }
1342        }
1343        
1344        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1345        
1346        /**
1347         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1348         * which must have the same length.
1349         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1350         * @param a first vector
1351         * @param b second vector
1352         * @return the dot product
1353         */
1354        public static double dotProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1355                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1356                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1357                double sum = 0;
1358                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1359                        sum = sum + a[i] * b[i];
1360                }
1361                return sum;
1362        }
1363        
1364        // a is considered a column vector, b is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1365        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1366        /**
1367         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1368         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1369         * m is the length of the second vector.
1370         * @param a first (column) vector (of length m)
1371         * @param b second (row) vector (of length n)
1372         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1373         */
1374        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1375                final int m = a.length;
1376                final int n = b.length;
1377                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1378                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1379                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1380                                M[i][j] = a[i] * b[j];
1381                        }
1382                }
1383                return M;
1384        }
1385
1386        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1387
1388        /**
1389         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1390         * @param a a vector
1391         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1392         */
1393        public static double normL1(final double[] a) {
1394                double sum = 0;
1395                for (double val : a) {
1396                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1397                }
1398                return sum;
1399        }
1400        
1401        /**
1402         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1403         * @param a a vector
1404         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1405         */
1406        public static float normL1(final float[] a) {
1407                double sum = 0;
1408                for (double val : a) {
1409                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1410                }
1411                return (float) sum;
1412        }
1413
1414        /**
1415         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1416         * @param a a vector
1417         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1418         */
1419        public static double normL2(final double[] a) {
1420                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(a));
1421        }
1422
1423        /**
1424         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1425         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1426         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1427         * @param a a vector
1428         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1429         */
1430        public static double normL2squared(final double[] a) {
1431                double sum = 0;
1432                for (double val : a) {
1433                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1434                }
1435                return sum;
1436        }
1437
1438        /**
1439         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1440         * @param x a vector
1441         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1442         */
1443        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1444                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1445        }
1446
1447        /**
1448         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1449         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1450         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1451         * @param a a vector
1452         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1453         */
1454        public static double normL2squared(final float[] a) {
1455                double sum = 0;
1456                for (double val : a) {
1457                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1458                }
1459                return sum;
1460        }
1461        
1462        // Normalize vectors
1463        
1464        /**
1465         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1466         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1467         * @param a a vector
1468         * @return the normalized vector
1469         */
1470        public static double[] normalize(final double[] a) {
1471                double[] xx = duplicate(a);
1472                normalizeD(xx);
1473                return xx;
1474        }
1475        
1476        /**
1477         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1478         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1479         * @param a a vector
1480         */
1481        public static void normalizeD(final double[] a) {
1482                double normx = normL2(a);
1483                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1484                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector " + Matrix.toString(a));
1485                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, a);
1486        }
1487        
1488        /**
1489         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1490         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1491         * @param a a vector
1492         * @return the normalized vector
1493         */
1494        public static float[] normalize(final float[] a) {
1495                float[] xx = duplicate(a);
1496                normalizeD(xx);
1497                return xx;
1498        }
1499        
1500        /**
1501         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1502         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1503         * @param a a vector
1504         */
1505        public static void normalizeD(final float[] a) {
1506                double normx = normL2(a);
1507                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1508                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1509                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), a);
1510        }
1511        
1512        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1513        
1514        /** 
1515         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1516         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1517         * number of elements.
1518         * @param a first vector
1519         * @param b second vector
1520         * @return the distance
1521         */
1522        public static double distL2(double[] a, double[] b) {
1523                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1524        }
1525        
1526        /** 
1527         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1528         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1529         * number of elements.
1530         * @param a first vector
1531         * @param b second vector
1532         * @return the squared distance
1533         */
1534        public static double distL2squared(double[] a, double[] b) {
1535                double sum = 0;
1536                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1537                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1538                }
1539                return sum;
1540        }
1541        
1542        /** 
1543         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1544         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1545         * number of elements.
1546         * @param a first vector
1547         * @param b second vector
1548         * @return the distance
1549         */
1550        public static float distL2(float[] a, float[] b) {
1551                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1552        }
1553        
1554        /** 
1555         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1556         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1557         * number of elements.
1558         * @param a first vector
1559         * @param b second vector
1560         * @return the squared distance
1561         */
1562        public static float distL2squared(float[] a, float[] b) {
1563                double sum = 0;
1564                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1565                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1566                }
1567                return (float) sum;
1568        }
1569        
1570        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1571        
1572        /**
1573         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1574         * @param A a matrix
1575         * @return the norm of the matrix
1576         */
1577        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1578                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1579                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1580                double s = 0;
1581                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1582                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1583                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1584                        }
1585                }
1586                return Math.sqrt(s);
1587        }
1588
1589        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1590
1591        /**
1592         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1593         * {@code double[]} vector.
1594         * @param a a vector
1595         * @return the sum of vector elements
1596         */
1597        public static double sum(final double[] a) {
1598                double sum = 0;
1599                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1600                        sum = sum + a[i];
1601                }
1602                return sum;
1603        }
1604        
1605        /**
1606         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1607         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1608         * @param A a matrix
1609         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1610         */
1611        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1612                double sum = 0;
1613                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1614                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1615                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1616                        }
1617                }
1618                return sum;
1619        }
1620        
1621        /**
1622         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1623         * {@code float[]} vector.
1624         * @param a a vector
1625         * @return the sum of vector elements
1626         */
1627        public static double sum(final float[] a) {
1628                double sum = 0;
1629                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1630                        sum = sum + a[i];
1631                }
1632                return sum;
1633        }
1634        
1635        /**
1636         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1637         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1638         * @param A a matrix
1639         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1640         */
1641        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1642                double sum = 0;
1643                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1644                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1645                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1646                        }
1647                }
1648                return sum;
1649        }
1650        
1651        // --------------------------------------------------
1652        
1653        /**
1654         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1655         * @param A a matrix
1656         * @param row the row index
1657         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1658         */
1659        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1660                return sum(A[row]);
1661        }
1662        
1663        /**
1664         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1665         * @param A a matrix
1666         * @param row the row index
1667         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1668         */
1669        public static double sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1670                return sum(A[row]);
1671        }
1672        
1673
1674        /**
1675         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1676         * @param A a matrix
1677         * @param col the column index
1678         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1679         */
1680        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1681                double sum = 0;
1682                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1683                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1684                }
1685                return sum;
1686        }
1687        
1688        /**
1689         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1690         * @param A a matrix
1691         * @param col the column index
1692         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1693         */
1694        public static double sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1695                double sum = 0;
1696                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1697                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1698                }
1699                return sum;
1700        }
1701        
1702        /**
1703         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1704         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1705         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1706         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1707         */
1708        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1709                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1710                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1711                        double sum = 0;
1712                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1713                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1714                        }
1715                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1716                }
1717                return sumVec;
1718        }
1719        
1720        /**
1721         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1722         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1723         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1724         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1725         */
1726        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1727                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1728                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1729                        double sum = 0;
1730                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1731                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1732                        }
1733                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1734                }
1735                return sumVec;
1736        }
1737        
1738        /**
1739         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1740         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1741         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1742         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1743         */
1744        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1745                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1746                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1747                        double sum = 0;
1748                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1749                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1750                        }
1751                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1752                }
1753                return sumVec;
1754        }
1755        
1756        /**
1757         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1758         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1759         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1760         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1761         */
1762        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1763                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1764                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1765                        double sum = 0;
1766                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1767                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1768                        }
1769                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1770                }
1771                return sumVec;
1772        }
1773        
1774        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1775        
1776        /**
1777         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1778         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1779         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1780         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1781         * 
1782         * @param a a vector
1783         * @return the index of the smallest value
1784         */
1785        public static int idxMin(double[] a) {
1786                if (a.length == 0)
1787                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1788                double minval = a[0];
1789                int minidx = 0;
1790                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1791                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1792                                minval = a[i];
1793                                minidx = i;
1794                        }
1795                }
1796                return minidx;
1797        }
1798        
1799        /**
1800         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1801         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1802         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1803         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1804         * 
1805         * @param a a vector
1806         * @return the index of the smallest value
1807         */
1808        public static int idxMin(float[] a) {
1809                if (a.length == 0)
1810                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1811                float minval = a[0];
1812                int minidx = 0;
1813                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1814                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1815                                minval = a[i];
1816                                minidx = i;
1817                        }
1818                }
1819                return minidx;
1820        }
1821        
1822        
1823        /**
1824         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1825         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1826         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1827         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1828         * 
1829         * @param a a vector
1830         * @return the index of the largest value
1831         */
1832        public static int idxMax(double[] a) {
1833                if (a.length == 0)
1834                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1835                double maxval = a[0];
1836                int maxidx = 0;
1837                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1838                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1839                                maxval = a[i];
1840                                maxidx = i;
1841                        }
1842                }
1843                return maxidx;
1844        }
1845        
1846        /**
1847         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1848         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1849         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1850         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1851         * 
1852         * @param a a vector
1853         * @return the index of the largest value
1854         */
1855        public static int idxMax(float[] a) {
1856                if (a.length == 0)
1857                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1858                float maxval = a[0];
1859                int maxidx = 0;
1860                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1861                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1862                                maxval = a[i];
1863                                maxidx = i;
1864                        }
1865                }
1866                return maxidx;
1867        }
1868        
1869        
1870        /**
1871         * Returns the smallest value in the
1872         * specified vector. 
1873         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1874         * @param a a vector
1875         * @return the largest value
1876         */
1877        public static float min(final float[] a) {
1878                if (a.length == 0)
1879                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1880                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1881                for (float val : a) {
1882                        if (val < minval) {
1883                                minval = val;
1884                        }
1885                }
1886                return minval;
1887        }
1888        
1889        /**
1890         * Returns the smallest value in the
1891         * specified vector. 
1892         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1893         * @param a a vector
1894         * @return the largest value
1895         */
1896        public static double min(final double[] a) {
1897                if (a.length == 0)
1898                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1899                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1900                for (double val : a) {
1901                        if (val < minval) {
1902                                minval = val;
1903                        }
1904                }
1905                return minval;
1906        }
