1907        
1908        /**
1909         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector. 
1910         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1911         * @param a a vector
1912         * @return the largest value
1913         */
1914        public static double max(final double[] a) {
1915                if (a.length == 0)
1916                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1917                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1918                for (double val : a) {
1919                        if (val > maxval) {
1920                                maxval = val;
1921                        }
1922                }
1923                return maxval;
1924        }
1925
1926        /**
1927         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1928         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1929         * @param a a vector
1930         * @return the largest value
1931         */
1932        public static float max(final float[] a) {
1933                if (a.length == 0)
1934                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1935                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1936                for (float val : a) {
1937                        if (val > maxval) {
1938                                maxval = val;
1939                        }
1940                }
1941                return maxval;
1942        }
1943        
1944        /**
1945         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
1946         * @param A a matrix
1947         * @return the largest matrix value
1948         */
1949        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1950                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1951                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1952                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1953                                if (val > maxval) {
1954                                        maxval = val;
1955                                }
1956                        }
1957                }
1958                return maxval;
1959        }
1960        
1961        /**
1962         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
1963         * @param A a matrix
1964         * @return the largest matrix value
1965         */
1966        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1967                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1968                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1969                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1970                                if (val > maxval) {
1971                                        maxval = val;
1972                                }
1973                        }
1974                }
1975                return maxval;
1976        }
1977        
1978        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1979        
1980        /**
1981         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1982         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1983         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1984         */
1985        public static float[] join(float[]... as) {
1986                int n = 0;
1987                for (float[] x : as) {
1988                        n = n + x.length;
1989                }
1990                float[] va = new float[n];
1991                int j = 0;
1992                for (float[] x : as) {
1993                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1994                                va[j] = x[i];
1995                                j++;
1996                        }
1997                }               
1998                return va;
1999        }
2000
2001        /**
2002         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2003         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2004         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2005         */
2006        public static double[] join(double[]... as) {
2007                int n = 0;
2008                for (double[] x : as) {
2009                        n = n + x.length;
2010                }
2011                double[] va = new double[n];    
2012                int j = 0;
2013                for (double[] x : as) {
2014                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2015                                va[j] = x[i];
2016                                j++;
2017                        }
2018                }               
2019                return va;
2020        }
2021        
2022        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
2023        
2024        /**
2025         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2026         * which must have the same length.
2027         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2028         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2029         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2030         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2031         * @return the interpolated vector
2032         */
2033        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
2034                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
2035                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2036                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2037                }
2038                return c;
2039        }
2040        
2041        /**
2042         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2043         * which must have the same length.
2044         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2045         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2046         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2047         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2048         * @return the interpolated vector
2049         */
2050        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
2051                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
2052                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2053                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2054                }
2055                return c;
2056        }
2057        
2058        
2059        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
2060        
2061        /**
2062         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
2063         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
2064         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
2065         * specified Cartesian vector.
2066         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
2067         * @param ac a Cartesian vector
2068         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
2069         */
2070        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] ac) {
2071                double[] xh = new double[ac.length + 1];
2072                for (int i = 0; i < ac.length; i++) {
2073                        xh[i] = ac[i];
2074                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2075                }
2076                return xh;
2077        }
2078        
2079        /**
2080         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
2081         * vector, which is one element shorter.
2082         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2083         * @param ah a homogeneous vector
2084         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2085         */
2086        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] ah) throws DivideByZeroException {
2087                double[] xc = new double[ah.length - 1];
2088                final double s = 1 / ah[ah.length - 1];
2089                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2090                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2091                for (int i = 0; i < ah.length - 1; i++) {
2092                        xc[i] = s * ah[i];
2093                }
2094                return xc;
2095        }
2096        
2097        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2098        
2099        /**
2100         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2101         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2102         * @param A a square matrix
2103         * @return the determinant
2104         */
2105        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2106                if (!A.isSquare())
2107                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2108                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2109        }
2110        
2111        /**
2112         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2113         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2114         * @param A a square matrix
2115         * @return the determinant
2116         */
2117        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2118                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2119        }
2120        
2121        /**
2122         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2123         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2124         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2125         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2126         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2127         * @return the determinant
2128         */
2129        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2130                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2131                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2132                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2133        }
2134        
2135        /**
2136         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2137         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2138         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2139         * @return the determinant
2140         */
2141        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2142                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2143                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2144                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2145        }
2146        
2147
2148        /**
2149         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2150         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2151         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2152         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2153         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2154         * @return the determinant
2155         */
2156        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2157                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2158                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2159                return 
2160                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2161                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2162                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2163                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2164                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2165                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2166        }
2167        
2168        /**
2169         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2170         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2171         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2172         * @return the determinant
2173         */
2174        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2175                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2176                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2177                return
2178                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2179                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2180                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2181                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2182                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2183                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2184        }
2185
2186
2187        
2188        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2189        
2190        /**
2191         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2192         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2193         * @param A a square matrix
2194         * @return the trace 
2195         */
2196        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2197                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2198                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2199                if (m != n) 
2200                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2201                double s = 0;
2202                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2203                                s = s + A[i][i];
2204                }
2205                return s;
2206        }
2207        
2208        /**
2209         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2210         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2211         * @param A a square matrix
2212         * @return the trace 
2213         */
2214        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2215                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2216                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2217                if (m != n) 
2218                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2219                double s = 0;
2220                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2221                                s = s + A[i][i];
2222                }
2223                return (float) s;
2224        }
2225        
2226        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2227        
2228        /**
2229         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2230         * The original matrix is not modified.
2231         * @param A a matrix
2232         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2233         */
2234        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2235                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2236                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2237                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2238                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2239                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2240                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2241                        }
2242                }
2243                return At;
2244        }
2245        
2246        /**
2247         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2248         * The original matrix is not modified.
2249         * @param A a matrix
2250         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2251         */
2252        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2253                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2254                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2255                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2256                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2257                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2258                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2259                        }
2260                }
2261                return At;
2262        }
2263        
2264        
2265        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2266        
2267        /**
2268         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2269         * using the specified tolerance value.
2270         * @param a a vector
2271         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2272         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2273         */
2274        public static boolean isZero(double[] a, double tolerance) {
2275                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2276                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2277                                return false;
2278                        }
2279                }
2280                return true;
2281        }
2282        
2283        /**
2284         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2285         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2286         * @param a a vector
2287         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2288         */
2289        public static boolean isZero(double[] a) {
2290                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2291        }
2292        
2293        /**
2294         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2295         * using the specified tolerance value.
2296         * @param a a vector
2297         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2298         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2299         */
2300        public static boolean isZero(float[] a, float tolerance) {
2301                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2302                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2303                                return false;
2304                        }
2305                }
2306                return true;
2307        }
2308        
2309        /**
2310         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2311         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2312         * @param a a vector
2313         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2314         */
2315        public static boolean isZero(float[] a) {
2316                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2317        }
2318        
2319        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2320        
2321        /**
2322         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2323         * using the specified tolerance value.
2324         * @param A a matrix
2325         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2326         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2327         */
2328        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2329                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2330                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2331                                return false;
2332                        }
2333                }
2334                return true;
2335        }
2336        
2337        /**
2338         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2339         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2340         * @param A a matrix
2341         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2342         */
2343        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2344                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2345        }
2346        
2347        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2348        
2349        /**
2350         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code double[]} vector.
2351         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2352         * 
2353         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
2354         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2355         */
2356        public static double[] sort(double[] a) {
2357                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2358                Arrays.sort(y);
2359                return y;
2360        }
2361        
2362        /**
2363         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code float[]} vector.
2364         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2365         * 
2366         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
2367         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2368         */
2369        public static float[] sort(float[] a) {
2370                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2371                Arrays.sort(y);
2372                return y;
2373        }
2374        
2375        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2376        
2377        /**
2378         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2379         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
2380         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2381         * @param A a square matrix
2382         * @return the inverse matrix
2383         */
2384        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2385                if (!isSquare(A))
2386                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2387                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2388                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2389        }
2390        
2391        /**
2392         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2393         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
2394         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2395         * @param A a square matrix
2396         * @return the inverse matrix
2397         */
2398        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2399                if (!isSquare(A))
2400                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2401                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2402                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2403        }
2404
2405        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2406        
2407        /**
2408         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2409         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2410         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2411         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2412         * Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2413         * 
2414         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2415         * @param b a vector of length n
2416         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2417         */
2418        
2419        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2420                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2421                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2422        }
2423        
2424        /**
2425         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2426         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2427         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2428         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2429         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
2430         * 
2431         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2432         * @param b a vector of length n
2433         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2434         */
2435        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2436                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2437                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2438                }
2439                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2440                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2441                }
2442//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2443                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2444                RealVector x = null;
2445                try {
2446                        x = solver.solve(b);
2447                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2448                return x;
2449        }
2450        
2451        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2452        
2453        /**
2454         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2455         * @param a a vector
2456         * @return the string representation
2457         */
2458        public static String toString(double[] a) {
2459                if (a == null) {
2460                        return String.valueOf(a);
2461                }
2462                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2463                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2464                printToStream(a, strm);
2465                return bas.toString();
2466        }
2467        
2468        /**
2469         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2470         * @param a a vector
2471         * @return the string representation
2472         */
2473        public static String toString(float[] a) {
2474                if (a == null) {
2475                        return String.valueOf(a);
2476                }
2477                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2478                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2479                printToStream(a, strm);
2480                return bas.toString();
2481        }
2482        
2483        /**
2484         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2485         * @param a a vector
2486         * @return the string representation
2487         */
2488        public static String toString(RealVector a) {
2489                if (a == null) {
2490                        return String.valueOf(a);
2491                }
2492                else {
2493                        return toString(a.toArray());
2494                }
2495        }
2496

2499         * @param A a matrix
2500         * @return the string representation
2501         */
2502        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
2503                if (A == null) {
2504                        return String.valueOf(A);
2505                }
2506                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2507                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2508                printToStream(A, strm);
2509                return bas.toString();
2510        }

2513         * Returns a string representation of the specified matrix.
2514         * @param A a matrix
2515         * @return the string representation
2516         */
2517        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
2518                if (A == null) {
2519                        return String.valueOf(A);
2520                }
2521                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2522                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2523                printToStream(A, strm);
2524                return bas.toString();
2525        }

2528         * Returns a string representation of the specified matrix.
2529         * @param A a matrix
2530         * @return the string representation
2531         */
2532        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
2533                if (A == null) {
2534                        return String.valueOf(A);
2535                }
2536                else {
2537                        return toString(A.getData());
2538                }
2539        }
2540        
2541        // --------------------
2542        
2543        /**
2544         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2545         * the specified output stream.
2546         * @param a the vector
2547         * @param strm the output stream
2548         * @see #toString(double[])
2549         */
2550        public static void printToStream(double[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2551                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2552                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2553                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2554                        if (i > 0)
2555                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2556                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2557                }
2558                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2559                strm.flush();
2560        }
2561        
2562        /**
2563         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2564         * the specified output stream.
2565         * @param A the matrix
2566         * @param strm the output stream
2567         * @see #toString(double[][])
2568         */
2569        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2570                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2571                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2572                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2573                        if (i == 0)
2574                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2575                        else
2576                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2577                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2578                                if (j == 0) 
2579                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2580                                else
2581                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2582                        }
2583                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2584                }
2585                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2586                strm.flush();
2587        }
2588        
2589        /**
2590         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2591         * the specified output stream.
2592         * @param a the vector
2593         * @param strm the output stream
2594         * @see #toString(float[])
2595         */
2596        public static void printToStream(float[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2597                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2598                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2599                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2600                        if (i > 0)
2601                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2602                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2603                }
2604                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2605                strm.flush();
2606        }
2607        
2608        /**
2609         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2610         * the specified output stream.
2611         * @param A the matrix
2612         * @param strm the output stream
2613         * @see #toString(float[][])
2614         */
2615        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2616                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2617                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2618                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2619                        if (i == 0)
2620                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2621                        else
2622                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2623                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2624                                if (j == 0) 
2625                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2626                                else
2627                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2628                        }
2629                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2630                }
2631                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2632                strm.flush();
2633        }

2635        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2636        
2637        /** Thrown when the dimensions of matrix/vector arguments do not match. */
2638        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {          
2639                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2640                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2641                }
2642                public IncompatibleDimensionsException(String msg) {
2643                        super(msg);
2644                }
2645        }
2646        
2647        /** Thrown when a non-square matrix is encountered where a square matrix is assumed. */
2648        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2649                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2650                        super("square matrix expected");
2651                }
2652                public NonsquareMatrixException(String msg) {
2653                        super(msg);
2654                }
2655        }
2656        
2657        /** Thrown when source and target objects are identical but shouldn't. */
2658        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2659                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2660                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2661                }
2662                public SameSourceTargetException(String msg) {
2663                        super(msg);
2664                }
2665        }
2666        
2667        /** Thrown when the length of some vector is zero. */
2668        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {        
2669                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2670                        super("vector length must be at least 1");
2671                }
2672                public ZeroLengthVectorException(String msg) {
2673                        super(msg);
2674                }
2675        }
